headline: In this video, we're going to discuss distance and displacement
If I say you traveled 200 miles, am I describing distance or displacement
Speed tells us how fast something is moving every second
Speed is a scalar quantity and velocity is a vector quantity
Acceleration tells you how fast the speed is changing
Whenever acceleration and velocity have same sign, the object is speeding up
Now, let's move on to gravitational acceleration. It varies for different planets and other very large objects
The gravitational acceleration affects the vertical velocity. It doesn't affect the horizontal velocity
The next topic that you want to be familiar with is something called projectile motion
If the trajectory is symmetrical, velocities have opposite signs
An object at rest will remain at rest unless acted on by a force
The net force of an object is equal to the mass times the acceleration
